data.title: owned land project in East Sussex
data.meta_description: Welcome to Sacred Earth - A community-owned land project East Sussex that is dedicated to life, learning and working in harmony with nature.
data.text:
For people, for nature

Sacred Earth is a land-based project that connects people with nature, for the wellbeing of both. We specialise in experiential learning and mentoring, using the natural world as a key element in the process. We also see ourselves as environmental custodians of our beautiful 40-acre site in Horam, East Sussex.

We’re a Community Benefit Society (CBS), which means any profits we make are returned to the community organisation rather than being distributed among members or external shareholders. You can join our CBS by investing just £50 in shares. This gives you a direct say in our future and discounts on all our courses. Click here to find out more.

More information about us

What is Sacred Earth?

Find out more about our community aims »

Read our vision statement »

What do people say about us?

“My children absolutely love the Earth Steward Apprenticeship (ESA), it is what they live for! They are deeply immersed in all things nature connection. They have built incredible skills, knowledge and understanding of nature’s ways – fire making, plants and foraging, bird language, and so much more.

“They feel so at home when they are at ESA. They are deeply inspired by their incredible mentors at Sacred Earth, who each bring such different gifts.

“It is an utter delight to see my children unfolding and expanding in these ways, and I feel our whole family journey is so deeply enriched by our growing connection with nature.

“Thank you from my heart for all that you give to the young people of today, who will be the ones taking our earth into the future – this gives me so much hope and inspiration.”

Tina.
